class header.

note, ensure that the pointers passed in persists through the life of this object. We do not assume ownership of the pointers or the data. Also, the vertices passed in must be in a triangle list format. Therefor, count must be a multiple of 3.

File: GrTSGen.cpp Author: Kevin Bray Created: 10-30-04 Copyright © 2004 Bootstrap Games project includes. class GrTSGen ctor & dtor

the pointers passed in must be able to contain a tangent and binormal for every vertex specified by 'count' in the constructor.

make sure GenTS isn't called multiple times per mesh... this would be horribly costly and inexcusably redundant.

for each triangle face, generate the tangent space basis.

figure out direction of S&T for the current triangle.

if we have an acceptable amount of area...

u-tangent.

v-tangent.

we have a degenerate triangle.

now calculate the tangent and binormal for each vertex. This is similar to smoothing normals on a mesh. Since the triangle linking discriminates normals, we can simply smooth with neighbors.

for each vertex...

try to find a triangle that has a similar vertex.

skip this triangle.
